intro: Scopolia parviflora var. grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora variety of the lesser bluebell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrant blooms and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
